ratings.comment: Rather solid professor in my opinion: grades and lectures fairly, test are mostly just taken out of the homework etc etc. The class is difficult and the materials can feel very abstract and unintuitive, but this is just the nature of an college Abstract Algebra class.

Terrible professor for Math 541, Smart guy but has zero awareness of whether or not what he is saying in lecture makes sense to a bunch of people who've never seen the content and never motivates concepts or ideas
Lecture is hard. Tests are easy.

Amazing lecturer! Covers all material, and explains it in a clear fashion. Since the class pace is somewhat quick, I would recommend using the textbook (you can get it free online) so you can read the material/ lesson beforehand and keep up; his lectures will also make more sense. I would not mind if I had to take a class with him again.

Prof. Yang is a great lecturer and it is clear he has a very deep understanding of the subject. Although he can make errors sometimes, his explanation of the subject matter is usually crystal clear. He responds to emails extremely quickly and kindly compared to other professors. Excellent professor overall!

I did not appreciate the only available office hours being on Monday mornings. He went pretty fast during lecture but I suppose he did have lots of content to cover. He was also a very generous grader and provided very helpful practice tests for the exams. Overall a very tough course that made his lectures hard to follow but maybe that's on me.

I thought this class was quite enjoyable once you understood the material. Don't miss the lectures cause it's really hard to catch up once you miss something. Ziquan always answered questions during lectures and adapted to students' needs throughout the semester. 4 exams make up most of the grade, but grade scale is adjusted in favor of students.

Linear algebra is a hard class, but Ziquan always tried his best to help. His lecture is okay, occasionally dry, but he has nerd humor that makes it bearable. He is a fair professor I can tell he will definitely improve! He's also dripped out - see his shoes and his 4 foot long golden-chain pocket watch (I'm not joking). He is a Sigma Male.

Lectures are fast/confusing at times, but he is always open to slowing down or answering questions along the way. Easy/not too much homework. Majority of grade is determined by just 4 tests. Tests are hard, but he's flexible with adjusting grading criteria so the class does well overall. If you just go to lecture and read the book you'll do well

Linear algebra is a hard class, but Ziquan tries his best to help students. His lecture is OK, sometimes a bit dry, but he provides comprehensive lecture notes. He's responsive and accessible outside of the class, usually responding to emails within 6 hours. He won't trick you and I can tell he will be better after teaching a few more semesters.

Honestly, he goes fast through lectures and they are not that useful. Almost all of my learning was from the things I did outside of class to teach myself. The only good thing is that the grading was quite generous, and we got an exam drop plus the grade thresholds were lowered slightly.

Professor Yangs lecture is fine. The lecture notes on the Canvas page are very helpful for review. The main problem is because this is his first teaching in this university, so there are some issues in controlling the difficulty of the topic and the classroom progress, but in general, he is a good professor.

math do be hard doe He's nice. Linear algebra is hard to understand for me, and it's easy to feel lost during the lectures. The average grade for the first two midterms was 80%. The third midterm's average was around 50%. In response, he decided to drop the curve the last midterm to around 75% and also drop everyone's lowest midterm grade.

Enjoyable lectures, but often explains complex topics without giving the basic building blocks, so most people were completely lost. It took a lot of outside sources to actually understand the material; the avg on the 3rd midterm was 60%. I'm sure he'll get more experienced with time and become a great professor, but this semester was a struggle
Ziquan has that nerd humor that makes lecture enjoyable even if the content is difficult. You definitely need to pay attention in order to do well but the class is very well organized.
